title: Padání Firefoxu - přeinstalace - ztráta oblíbených, otevřených panelů či přihlašovacích údajů
content:
Vážení,

provozoval jsem již mnoho let internetový prohlížeč Mozilla Firefox na svém notebooku HP ProBook s OS Win 7. Měl jsem tam otevřené panely, uložené potřebné odkazy i přihlašovací údaje. Nečekaně mi Firefox spadnul a následně nešel vůbec pustit - vždy se zobrazilo dialogové okno Hlášení pádu, kde mi to nabízelo možnost odeslat zprávu o tom pádu, aplikaci restartovat či ukončit. Opakovaně jsem zkoušel všechny možnosti, ale nic nepomohlo - vždy se následně otevřelo stejné okno s hlášením pádu...

Hledal jsem v možnostech Programů a funkcí, kde u programu Firefox byla k dispozici možnost pouze odinstalovat...

Hledal jsem pomoc na webu, našel i stránku https://support.mozilla.org/cs/kb/firefox-pri-spusteni-opakovane-pada kde jsem si myslel, že jsem našel pomoc, když se tam píše: Pokud se Firefox vůbec nespustí, ale objeví se Oznamovatel pádu aplikací Mozilla, přečtěte si článek Firefox nejde spustit. " Doporučený článek jsem si přečetl: https://support.mozilla.org/cs/kb/Firefox%20nejde%20spustit ale tam se o této mé variantě následně už vůbec nemluví...

Zkoušel jsem Firefox pustit i v uváděném režimu Řešení potíží (s klávesou Shift), ale to také nepomohlo.

Tak jsem zkusil Firefox znovu instalovat s nadějí, že by mi to mohlo nabídnout i variantu opravy. Stáhnul jsem si instalační iniciační soubor a nová instalace se spustila. Instalační program oprávněně zjistil, že už tam Firefox nainstalovaný je a nabídnul mi možnost, jestli chci vše do výchozího nastavení, což jsem nepovolil - předpokládal jsem tedy, že mi ve Firefoxu zůstane vše, jako jsem měl doposud.

Nicméně po dokončení Firefoxu a jeho spuštění mám zcela novou a prázdnou instalaci?! Je nějaká cesta zpět, jak se dostat k oblíbeným položkám, uloženým přihlašovacím údajům, otevřeným panelům?

Děkuji za radu či pomoc v této zoufalé situaci. Petr Kulma
creator: petr18

Wie kann ich dies wieder rückgängig machen, so dass wie davor die Eingabe eines Passwortes immer erforderlich ist? Über das Anwendungsmenü Funktion Passwörter geht es jedenfalls nicht. Hier kann im Feld Passwort der Inhalt nicht entfernt werden sondern nur die kompletten Zugangsdaten. Bitte um Hinweis. Vielen Dank!

title: How do I get my sync data restored to a previous state? Firefox has a programming issue and I need a staff member from there to help me...
content: I have Firefox 107.0.1 installed on my windows 11 22H2 OS Build 22621.900 and I had around 63 tabs or so open. I ALWAYS click the "X" in the top right corner and then it brings up the "close xx" tabs window. Then when I reopen firefox I can click history>restore previous session. Anyways I closed regular firefox.. because a friend of mine wanted to look up something but not interfere with my open tabs so we opened firefox private browsing.. thinking it wouldn't interfere with normal firefox... Yet when I went back to normal firefox and tried to go to history>restore previous session it was grayed out. So how do I get a hold of Mozilla to restore my account and stuff to 12/01/2022 at around 3am CST? Also how do I let them know that firefox private browsing has this issue with messing up open tabs in non-private browsing firefox? This is severely annoying and disappointing. I have tabs open for a reason and they should all stay there until I close them. But now they're gone and I wish to have them back. So if someone could let me know how to get a hold of a Mozilla/firefox staff member so they can revert my account that would be awesome. Just to be clear I was able to replicate the issue by having a few tabs open in normal firefox and then closing it.. then opening private browsing firefox and closing it. You should be able to go to history>restore previous session in normal firefox to be able to get your tabs back.. but are unable to do so after opening and closing private browsing firefox. Why is this? I thought they were separate and shouldn't interfere with each other in this way?
creator: that1guyyep101

title: disable the force restart
content:
I hate being forced to restart my firefox following an update that I didn't ask for. It's particularly annoying when I'm on a video-conference and I start a search and I'm forced to come back to the conference, wait for them to accept me again, etc...

At a minimum, an option should be offered to disable the restart (I didn't find any).

Thank

title: problems caused by updates
content:
Because of your last two updates, I can no longer log into my bank account using Firefox. With version 107.0 I lost the ability to log into www.USBANK.COM and get the account screen, I just get a blank tabbed page, but the USBANK.COM system would still send a text to my phone with the security code required to log in.

With version 107.0.1 released today I no longer receive the text with the security code. Not that it matters because I can't get in any way..... it just gives me a blank screen tab. I now have to use the Microsoft browser to log in and do my banking.


November 15, 2022 Version 107.0, first offered to Release channel users on November 15, 2022

November 29, 2022 Version 107.0.1, first offered to Release channel users on November 29, 2022

Michael Hill
creator: michael.t.hill1969

title: Embedded vidoe in email link shows as preview not available
content:
Hi Firefoxers, I am wanting to test an email before I send it out to clients, the email has a link to a video in the heading of the page. When I click the link in the email it opens the webpage, but the link defaults to "preview not available" the rest of the page is viewable, but not the image of the video. At first I thought it was a broken link but when I send a test to colleagues using IE it opens automatically and they have the option play the video.

I made the following changes in Preferences > Privacy & Security > Autoplay > Settings > Allow Audio & Video

I refreshed the page, didn't work Restarted Firefox, still didn't work

Can I get some advice on the correct settings or where I am going wrong.

title: Two apparent error troubles in and with my Firefox account
content:
Hello!

Apparently my Firefox account, tuulen@gmail.com, has me as using Windows 10 although I upgraded to Windows 11 last spring and there is no obvious way for me to update that information.

I have a secondary email listed in my Firefox account, email.hp15c@gmail.com, but that secondary email is in need of verification and I am having trouble in getting that done. On my tuulen@gmail.com Gmail account I can send a test message to my email.hp15c@gmail.com Gmail account and can receive it there, but for some unknown reason my attempts to have that same secondary email verified have failed by its not appearing on my Gmail account where I have it listed as a secondary email. I also have spent time in trying find ways to correct this and to contact Google about this, but have not found any such corrective ways and have had no response from Google.

I thank you. – Doug
